step_feedback.feedback: While you attempted the shoulder blade squeeze, the significant movement in your elbows and wrists suggests you may be using other muscles instead of focusing on your shoulder blades. Try to keep your elbows and wrists still, concentrating on the movement originating from your upper back.
Good job maintaining a controlled circular motion in this step. Your elbow and wrist movement is reduced, indicating better engagement of the shoulder blades.

The second repetition shows increased movement in your elbows and wrists. Remember to keep your arms relaxed and focus on the circular motion originating from your shoulder blades. Deep breaths can help.

exercise_summary: You showed improvement in controlling shoulder blade movement during the exercise.  Focus on keeping your elbows and wrists still while performing the circular motion. Remember to breathe deeply as you pull your shoulders back.
